generalInfo:
Experience the best of adventure activities in two of the Himalayan nations of South Asia; Nepal and Bhutan. This tour starts from the land of the Mt. Everest; the birthplace of Gautama Buddha—Nepal; and finally steps to the last Shangri-La--Bhutan.

This 15-day adventure tour starts with sightseeing to the different UNESCO enlisted heritage sites, touring around ancient city Kathmandu, proceeds towards the city of lakes- Pokhara and finally reaches the oldest National park of Nepal, a sanctuary to the rare one-horned Rhinoceros- Chitwan.

Next, the tour sets about on a tour to Bhutan with visits to beautiful fortresses, museums and visits to farmhouses, hike up to the famous Taktshang Monastery popularly known as Tiger’s nest, experiencing local cuisines, relaxing hot stone bath after a tiring day and discovering some of the most sacred Buddhist monasteries, temples. This tour traversing through two different south Asian Himalayan countries, exploring the nature is absolutely physical strain-free and almost anyone in good shape can be a part of it without having to think twice about the physical or age restrictions.

Apart from short walks during sightseeing around different cities and some stairs, the only strenuous walk required during the whole tour is while hiking up to Tiger’s nest monastery in Bhutan. So, if you are eager to visit different countries with varying culture, tradition and beautiful landscapes without having to compromise with comfort, within one holiday in a short time frame then this trip is definitely for you. Experience two different countries in one holiday with Wonders of Nepal and Bhutan tour!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN KATHMANDU This is going to be the first day of Nepal adventure. At the arrival section of Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, one of our representatives will be waiting with a placard-carrying your name on it. The airport representative will take you to the hotel on a private vehicle. In the evening we meet for a welcome dinner and brief the tour. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals: welcome dinner

KATHMANDU TO POKHARA After breakfast, we head towards the beautiful Lake city Pokhara. After approximately 8-10 hours’ drive alongside beautiful villages and landscapes, we reach Pokhara. Upon reaching Pokhara, take a walk in a town to stretch your legs and explore a nightlife. Overnight at the hotel; Meals: breakfast

AROUND POKHARA Pokhara (city of lakes) is a beautiful city with alluring natural beauty. We will go for a full day sightseeing around the World Peace Stupa, Tal Barahi Temple, Begnas Lake, and others as per your choice. Boating around Fewa Lake is set to be an astounding experience. You can roam around the beautiful lakeside which comes alive in the evening. Overnight stay at the hotel; Meals: breakfast

DRIVE TO CHITWAN Today we drive towards the south western part of Nepal - Chitwan from Pokhara. It takes about 7 hours to reach Chitwan. Upon reaching we will have a lunch and then our naturalist will brief you about activities we can do. Later we will watch a sundowner and take a village walk to see the culture of Tharu community. Overnight stay at resort in Chitwan; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

ACTIVITIES IN SAURAHA We start our tour with a full day jungle safari in Chitwan National Park. We drive through the jungles on Jeep and later go for a canoe ride down the Rapti River. During the safari, we tour around the jungle and get chance to spot deer, the endangered one-horn rhinoceros, along with other wild animals. If lucky, we will get to spot the rare Royal Bengal Tiger. While canoeing, we get a close look at the Gharial and Mugger Crocodiles along with freshwater dolphins, otters, and wide varieties of water birds. In the evening, we observe Tharu cultural dance. Overnight at the hotel; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

DRIVE TO KATHMANDU Early in the morning, after breakfast, we drive towards Kathmandu from Chitwan. Driving along the plains of Terai, we gradually move along the winding road enjoying the beautiful landscapes of hilly terrains and small houses on the way. After almost 7 hours drive, we reach Kathmandu in the evening. Overnight at Kathmandu; Meals: breakfast

KATHMANDU SIGHTSEEING After breakfast, Kathmandu tour begins. Kathmandu valley is an incredibly diverse city with a breathtaking Newari culture, centuries-old Hindu and Buddhists cultural sites alongside a plethora of ancient monuments. The capital of the country and home to 7 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Kathmandu, bridges modern facilities with centuries-old traditions and cultures with its tourist-friendly accommodations and the ancestral etiquette “Atithi Devo Bhava” meaning "Guest is equivalent to God". Throughout the day, some of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Kathmandu will be observed. Evening is your free time to explore Thamel on your own. Overnight stay at the hotel; Meals: breakfast

KATHMANDU-PUNAKHA Upon arrival at Paro, your guide will pick you up and drive to Punakha via Thimpu. On the way after 45 minutes’ drive from Thimpu, we reach the highest pass between Thimpu and Punakha called Dochula pass (3140m) where on a clear day one can see a spectacular view of the Eastern Himalayas. Next, we proceed towards Chhimi Lakhang “a temple of fertility” which is dedicated to Lama Drukpa Kunley popularly known as the Devine Madman. Upon arrival we check in at the hotel and visit Punakha Dzong a very beautiful Bhutanese architecture surrounded by the Pho Chu (Male River) and Mo Chu (Female River) rivers, built-in 1637 by Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal, the unifier of Bhutan to serve as the religious and administrative centre of the region. Overnight at Punakha; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

PUNAKHA-PHOBJIKHA After breakfast, we leave Punakha and drive towards Phobjikha. Upon arrival at Phobjikha, we visit Gangteng Gompa, the oldest Nyingmapa temple in western Bhutan. Gangteng Gomba, “the temple on the hilltop”, was found in 1613 by the grandson of the great terton (treasure revealer), Pema Thinley. According to the Buddhist tradition of Bhutan, a person is a gifted practitioner who discovers ancient teachings and reintroduces them to the world. This monastery, one of the largest in Bhutan, contains a monastic school and houses the ninth reincarnation of the Gangtey Tulku. Every year on the 11th of November, villagers from all over the valley gather in the courtyard to celebrate the Black Necked Crane Festival. Locals wear their most beautiful ghos and kiras to watch the masked dances performed by the monks of Gangteng. Dressed as these cherished birds, school children dance the movements of the black necked crane to welcome the birds back to the valley. Every year, from the end of October and the beginning of November, the cranes migrate from the higher altitude plateaus of the Tibetan region to the valley for winter. Later we will visit, Crane Information Centre which provides all the information about birds. Overnight at hotel in Phobjikha; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

PHOBJIKHA SIGHTSEEING/ HIKE: After breakfast, we drive for an hour to the charming village called Longtey. On reaching Longtey, we hike for 3 to 3.5 hours towards Gangteng Gompa. Heading along a sloping pathway, passing through towering bushes of jade-hued bamboo, we reach a small group of Bhutanese style village houses featuring elevated platforms, intricately carved timber window panes and wood lined arched roofs. During the spring months, the woodlands on either side of the valley look particularly stunning, gloriously cloaked in a kaleidoscope of crimson, violet and candy floss coloured rhododendrons. In the winter months, the valley is splendidly shrouded in thick blankets of pearly white snow, on which mighty onyx and yaks graze. Next, we head down to the tranquil village of Kumbu, where it’s up to you to either end your walk or carry on to the deep valley floor and the Shedra, a renowned and mystical place of teaching. Overnight at homestay in Phobjikha; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

DRIVE TO PUNAKHA After breakfast, we go for the Nature Trail hike which is around 2 km walk. We enjoy the valley and meet the locals and enjoy the fresh lush green vegetations all around Bhutan. After the hike we bid farewell to Phobijkha valley and drive towards Punakha valley. Upon reaching Punakha valley we, visit the impressive Punakha Dzong built in 1637 by Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal to serve as the religious and administrative centre of the region. It is open for visitors during the Punakha festival (early spring) and in the summer months, after the monk body has returned to Thimpu. The Dzong is surrounded by the Pho Chu and Mo Chu rivers. This ancient fortress is the winter residence of the monastic order’s head and serves as the administrative headquarters for the Punakha region. After visiting the Punakha Dzong we take a leisurely walk for 5 to 10 minutes to reach the longest suspension bridge of Bhutan. Overnight at Punakha; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

DRIVE TO PARO After early breakfast, we drive back to Paro and check-in at the hotel. After lunch, we start the leisurely hike from the hotel. After almost 1 hour’s hike, we reach the hillside of Zuri Dzong which provides wonderful views down over the valley. The descending trail from the Dzong takes us to the National Museum where the hike ends. Perched above Paro Dzong, built in 1649 to protect the undefended dzong and renovated in 1968 to house the National Museum, the unusual round building is said to be in the shape of a conch shell, with 2.5m-thick walls. Next, we visit Ringpung Dzong, and in the evening, stroll around the main street for some interesting Himalayan artefacts or textiles or have a relaxing stay in the hotel. Overnight at Paro; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

HIKE TO TIGER’S NEST Trip to Bhutan is never complete without climbing to Taktsang. In the morning, we will hike to Taktsang; Tiger’s Nest. The walk of approximately 1.5 to 2 hours uphill takes us almost a kilometer above the Paro valley floor (for those who cannot hike we will arrange a horse to transfer up to cafeteria). As you wind your way breathlessly up the long, steep path towards Taktsang Lakhang, the monastery periodically reveals itself, rising out of the forest, closer and more solid with every re-appearances. Historically, it is believed Guru Rinpoche, arrived here on the back of a flying tigress after defeating a troublesome local demon in the eighth century and spent months in meditation, Thus, the cave gets its name Lakhang meaning "Tiger's Nest". It has been a place of pilgrimage ever since. Overnight at Paro; Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

RETURN TO KATHMANDU After breakfast, depending on your flight time, you will be escorted to the airport for a flight to Kathmandu. The rest of the day is your free time for shopping or leisure where you can visit spa, singing bowl session or local handicraft manufacturé to learn about projects for women in Nepal. Overnight in Nepal; Meals: breakfast

DEPARTURE After breakfast, according to your flight schedule, our representative will escort you to the airport for your return flight home. Check-in time is 3 hours prior to the departure. Say "Namaste" and until next time! Meals: breakfast
